description.raw:
This pull requests adds a plugin to allow breakable joints. The plugin can be attached to a joint force-torque sensor with a breaking force threshold specified in parameter `<breaking_force_N>`. If a force is detected that exceeds a specified threshold, then the joint is detached. An example model has been uploaded to [gazebo_models in branch breakable_test](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/commits/07116279eae8cf84d160132f26a03ca1153a3b8a). I have tested it with ODE and Bullet; it won't work in Simbody or DART due to #862 and #903.

The plugin required an API addition to ForceTorqueSensor in order to access the parent joint. I've started an [ABI-checker on Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/API_ABI%20checker/job/gazebo-any_to_any-abichecker-quantal-amd64/36/).

EDIT: Test with [gazebo_models pull request 70](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/70/test-model-for-breakable-walls/diff).

The plugin required an API addition to ForceTorqueSensor in order to access the parent joint. I've started an ABI-checker on Jenkins.
